intro: Oncosiphon schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter's onion weed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Oncosiphon schlechteri is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
